column4: could anybody help me answer my question above? - (on where to file a bug to request qt 4.5.1 in jaunty)
That's not really a bug now is it? More like a feature request.
there are a few bugs in qt 4.5.0 which manifest themselves as crashes in other programs, so it's really fixing multiple bugs
not for new features, 4.5.1 is mainly a bug-fixing release, not only "regular" bugs but also crash fixes
in that case you should file it as a bug against qtlib, with dependencies pointing to it from the programs that crash.
good idea, let's try that
though I think qt 4.5.1 is already in backports for jaunty, still apparantly people don't have backports enabled
anything you can tell me about that? is it enabled by default? etc
That's their choice :-)
most of the time, they have no clue
I wish I could help you with your RAID problem, but I've never done RAID

though, most problems of the BIOS skipping grub, is that it's not installed in the mbr of the first drive correctly, I don't think RAID is related to that, then again, I've never done it so I don't know for sure
try sudo grub-install /dev/sda and such things
at the moment I don't have an install on that box yet that recognizes my RAID setup.
I think RAID setup only starts after grub, possibly...
Hardware RAID definitely starts before grub
okay, well, I'll shut up
Thank you for trying, really I appreciate it, I wish it were that simple :-)
wish I could help you more :)
Thasnks for your kindness, I hope there is still someone around that can help with that...
usually ##linux is more helpful in more lower-level questions like that :)
Thanks for the suggestion, joining #linux now...
